title: Beyond the pack ice
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Mawson station (Australian Antarctic Territory)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Biology - Antarctica
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Arctic regions - Research
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Medicine - Research
Family, Gender Identity, Relationships & Sexuality/Social isolation
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Social isolation
description: Describes life on the inhospitable Antarctic continent. Animal and plant life is sparse but man has established himself. At the Mawson research station intensive study programmes include auroral physics, meteorology and medicine. The four months of daylight are packed with outdoor activities. Shows the annual arrival of the supply ship from Australia and describes some of the emotions of the men on the expedition.
